docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
kubectl-eks is kubectl plugin for amazon EKS.

you can check out announcement blog post here.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Check out install page for installation instructions.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: Check out Usage page for Usage instructions.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Check out Contributing page for Contributing instructions.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
If you want to contribute to this project in following ways:

  • Try it out and raise an Github issue here if,
  • you find any bug/issue

  • you have any feature request

  • Feel free to raise Pull request to fix the issue/bug or for new feature.

Thank you :)

docs.title: Using Krew
docs.text:
• You can add custom index as shown below and install the plugin from there. We are planning to submit this plugin to official Krew index as well, you can track the progress here.
kubectl krew index add surajincloud git@github.com:surajincloud/kubectl-eks.git
kubectl krew search eks
kubectl krew install surajincloud/kubectl-eks

docs.title: Install from Source
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/surajincloud/kubectl-eks
cd kubectl-eks
make

docs.title: Install from Releases
docs.text:
• Download latest binary from release page.

  • make it executable

chmod +x kubectl-eks
  • move it to one of the location from the PATH
mv kubectl-eks ~/.local/bin

docs.title: Install using Brew
docs.text:
brew tap surajincloud/tools
brew install kubectl-eks

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
• Verify the installation by running the following command.
$ kubectl eks --help
A kubectl plugin for Amazon EKS

Usage:
  kubectl-eks [command]

Available Commands:
  addons      A brief description of your command
  completion  Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
  help        Help about any command
  irsa        A brief description of your command
  nodes       List all EKS Nodes
  ssm         Access given EKS node via SSM
  version     Print the version of kubectl-eks
...
...

docs.title: Uninstallation
docs.text:
You can uninstall kubectl-eksas shown below,

$ kubectl krew uninstall eks
Uninstalled plugin: eks

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: Note: kubectl-eks is able to read region from aws credentials file, aws profile and environment variable, optionally you can pass it via --region flag. it is also able to read cluster name from the kubeconfig context, optionally you can pass it via --cluster flag or AWS_EKS_CLUSTER environment variable.

docs.title: Creates Kubeconfig
docs.text: kubectl eks kubeconfig --cluster your-cluster --region your-region --out

docs.title: Updates existing Kubeconfig
docs.text:
• fetch and update existing kubeconfig (~/.kube/config)
kubectl eks kubeconfig --cluster your-cluster --region your-region

docs.title: List addons
docs.text: kubectl eks addons --cluster your-cluster --region your-region

docs.title: List serviceaccount with IRSA information from all namespaces
docs.text: kubectl eks irsa

docs.title: List serviceaccount with IRSA information from given namespace
docs.text: kubectl eks irsa -n app-staging

docs.title: List nodes but get more information
docs.text: kubectl eks nodes

docs.title: List nodegroups but get more information
docs.text: kubectl eks nodegroups

docs.title: Access to EKS node via SSM
docs.text:
kubectl eks ssm <name-of-the-node>

Note: above command will only work if node IAM role has predefined IAM policy AmazonSSMManagedInstanceCore policy attached. Click here for more reference.

docs.title: List fargate profiles
docs.text: kubectl eks fargate --cluster your-cluster --region your-region

docs.title: Suggest an AMI
docs.text: kubectl eks suggest-ami
